channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: March Madness brackets are set. The SEC dominates the men's with a record 14 teams
item.description: In an all-time record, 14 of the 68 teams in the men's tournament all come from one conference — the SEC. In the women's, UCLA and South Carolina are top seeds. Games tip off this coming week.
item.content:encoded:
In an all-time record, 14 of the 68 teams in the men's tournament all come from one conference — the SEC. In the women's, UCLA and South Carolina are top seeds. Games tip off this coming week.

(Image credit: Brandon Sumrall/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Pope Francis seen praying in first photo since his hospitalization a month ago
item.description: In the image published online by the Holy See Press Office, the pontiff was seated in a wheelchair and praying in the private chapel of Rome's Gemelli Hospital.
item.content:encoded:
In the image published online by the Holy See Press Office, the pontiff was seated in a wheelchair and praying in the private chapel of Rome's Gemelli Hospital.

(Image credit: Vatican Press Hall)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Tren de Aragua — all you need to know about the Venezuelan gang
item.description: The Trump administration has invoked a 227-year-old law, the Alien Enemies Act, to target Tren de Aragua, a gang with its roots in the prisons of Venezuela. Who are they and how wide is their reach?
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration has invoked a 227-year-old law, the Alien Enemies Act, to target Tren de Aragua, a gang with its roots in the prisons of Venezuela. Who are they and how wide is their reach?

(Image credit: YURI CORTEZ)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: U.S. deports hundreds of Venezuelans to El Salvador, despite court order
item.description: It was not clear if the deportations happened before a D.C. federal judge ordered the administration to stop using wartime powers to deport anyone immediately, and turn around any planes in the air.
item.content:encoded:
It was not clear if the deportations happened before a D.C. federal judge ordered the administration to stop using wartime powers to deport anyone immediately, and turn around any planes in the air.

(Image credit: El Salvador Presidency)
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: The missing children of Syria: Hidden in orphanages under Assad, where are they now?
item.description: Assad's forces detained mothers and children and sent many of the youth to orphanages. Syrians whose children vanished during the war are now seeking information on their fate. NPR investigates.
item.content:encoded:
Assad's forces detained mothers and children and sent many of the youth to orphanages. Syrians whose children vanished during the war are now seeking information on their fate. NPR investigates.

(Image credit: Hani al-Farra)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: 59 dead and more than 150 injured in nightclub fire in North Macedonia
item.description: A massive nightclub fire killed 59 people early Sunday in North Macedonia 's eastern town of Kocani, and injured more than 150. The blaze broke out during a concert by a local pop group.
item.content:encoded:
A massive nightclub fire killed 59 people early Sunday in North Macedonia 's eastern town of Kocani, and injured more than 150. The blaze broke out during a concert by a local pop group.

(Image credit: Boris Grdanoski)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Forget about rare earth minerals. We need more copper
item.description: In recent weeks, you've likely heard a lot about rare-earth substances with hard-to-pronounce names, but experts warn that the shortage of another crucial metal, copper, could be just as concerning.
item.content:encoded:
In recent weeks, you've likely heard a lot about rare-earth substances with hard-to-pronounce names, but experts warn that the shortage of another crucial metal, copper, could be just as concerning.

(Image credit: Glenn Arcos)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: March Madness begins for NPR's College Podcast Challenge
item.description: Our 10 finalists for the best college podcasts in the country include students from some familiar schools, and a few surprises.
item.content:encoded: Our 10 finalists for the best college podcasts in the country include students from some familiar schools, and a few surprises.
item.dc:creator: Steve Drummond

item.title: Crew arrives on ISS to replace astronauts 'stranded' in space for nine months
item.description: Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore were only supposed to be in space for about a week when they launched in June, but problems with their Boeing Starliner spacecraft extended their journey for months.
item.content:encoded:
Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore were only supposed to be in space for about a week when they launched in June, but problems with their Boeing Starliner spacecraft extended their journey for months.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Federal judge blocks Trump's plan to target 'alien enemies' for deportation
item.description: Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.
item.content:encoded:
Trump invoked the wartime authority Alien Enemies Act, targeting members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua for expedited deportation. But a federal judge blocked the action Saturday evening.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo
